content.description: Start Low on two small pockets with good feet underneath the overhang. Use some crimps and a slopy ledge to set up for a dynamic move to a jug on the next ledge.
content.location: To the left of hot for teacher, on a protruding face.

content.description: Like all schoolyard bullies it's all hard until you throw down. After a few short moves it punks out.  Sitting start with your right foot the quarter thick edge and your left on the angling foot chip. Right hand on the angling flake and left on the low crimp. Bump get a high left foot, bump to the angled edge then throw for the sloper under the overhang. After this you should be home free and your bully cowering in the corner.
content.location: Far left on the School of Rock boulder chain just left of Short Bus.

content.description: Sit start on small crimpy pockets right in the middle of the wall, big move to the break, another big move to the lip and a good incut up and right, balancey top out watch out for trees
Sit start on a good flake, move left into a good slot, keep working left through big sharp jugs, big slap moves up top on slopers, and finish it out
content.location: Keep following the broken cliff line to find this boulder

content.description: Just like the short bus this problem is made for the little people. Stand start with your hands in the vertical crack and right foot on the generous for chip to the right. Gaston and bump the left then get a high foot onto the right start hold for Skoolyard Bully. Before you know it you'll be home free.  There's an optional sit start which is V3/V4 start sitting with your left hand on the crimp just left of the of the crack and your right on the miniscule ledge low in the crack.
content.location: School of Rock boulders, right off Skoolyard Bully.

content.description: Sit start with right hand in the undercling and left on the pad only pocket. Pull up hard and throw for the ledge under the overhang. Get high feet and gain a jug. Then you're home free.
content.location: Head around the corner right of Short Bus there's a mini dihedral with a cedar growing out of it. Hot for Teacher starts to the right

content.description: This chain of outcropping ranging from around 6-8' tall. Great for beginning boulderers to get used to topping out. With problems in the easy to mid range it's worth a look.
